meanings.definition: A state of disorder or untidiness.
meanings.sent1: The child's room was a muss of toys and clothes.
meanings.sent2: She quickly tidied up the muss on the table.
meanings.sent3: The puppy created a muss of torn paper all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: The wind created a muss of leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent5: The artist's studio was a colorful muss of paints and brushes.

meanings.sent1: Please don't muss up your hair before the party.
meanings.sent2: The kids always manage to muss the living room after playing.
meanings.sent3: He tried to muss up his friend's neatly arranged books as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm will muss the carefully raked garden.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous cat loves to muss up the freshly made bed.

meanings.definition: To handle or play with something in a careless or untidy way.
meanings.sent1: She would always muss with her hair when she was nervous.
meanings.sent2: The toddler began to muss with the buttons on the remote control.
meanings.sent3: He would muss with the sand in the sandbox, creating little mountains.
meanings.sent4: The magician mussed with the deck of cards before performing a trick.
meanings.sent5: The chef mussed with the ingredients, creating a delicious dish.
